message.content:
cs.IR, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.SI, cs.DB. 

This paper is about improving the performance of recommender systems by leveraging rich information. The paper proposes a feature-based matrix factorization approach, which is a common technique used in recommender systems. The paper discusses the use of various types of features, such as user features, item features, and contextual features, to improve the accuracy of recommendations. Based on this, the most likely sub-category is cs.IR (Information Retrieval), which deals with the retrieval of information from large collections of data. Other likely sub-categories include cs.LG (Machine Learning), cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence), cs.SI (Social and Information Networks), and cs.DB (Databases), as these areas are closely related to recommender systems and the use of features to improve their performance.
